head.title: July 16-22; Report on Murder of Gay G.I.

hedline.hl1: July 16-22; Report on Murder of Gay G.I.

block.p: After a 21-year-old gay private was bludgeoned to death with a baseball bat by a fellow soldier as he slept in his barracks last July, the Army opened an investigation into the atmosphere at Fort Campbell, the Kentucky Army base where the murder occurred. A new report has exonerated all officers of blame in the murder of Pfc. Barry Winchell and has concluded that no climate of homophobia exists at the base.

After a 21-year-old gay private was bludgeoned to death with a baseball bat by a fellow soldier as he slept in his barracks last July, the Army opened an investigation into the atmosphere at Fort Campbell, the Kentucky Army base where the murder occurred. A new report has exonerated all officers of blame in the murder of Pfc. Barry Winchell and has concluded that no climate of homophobia exists at the base.
Private Winchell's mother, who has sued the Army for the wrongful death of her son, called the report a cover-up.
